details: The engine is experiencing misfires in multiple cylinders, which leads to rough idling, loss of power, and poor fuel economy. This can cause long-term damage if left unaddressed.
causes: Faulty spark plugs or spark plug wires
Fuel delivery issues (e.g., clogged fuel injectors)
solutions: Replace faulty spark plugs and wires
Clean or replace clogged fuel injectors
Check and replace bad ignition coils
Repair vacuum leaks

details: The catalytic converter is not working efficiently on Bank 1, which may lead to excessive vehicle emissions and potential damage to the emission control system.
solutions: Replace the catalytic converter if necessary
Check and replace faulty oxygen sensors
Repair any exhaust leaks
Fix engine misfire issues

details: The air-fuel mixture is too lean on Bank 1, meaning there is too much air and not enough fuel in the combustion chamber, leading to poor performance and potential engine damage.
causes: Dirty or faulty mass airflow sensor (MAF)
solutions: Fix vacuum leaks
Clean or replace the mass airflow sensor (MAF)
Replace clogged fuel filter
Check and repair low fuel pressure issues

description: Evaporative Emission Control System Leak Detected (Large Leak)
details: This code indicates a large leak in the evaporative emission control system (EVAP), which prevents fuel vapors from escaping into the atmosphere.
solutions: Tighten or replace the gas cap
Repair or replace damaged EVAP hoses
Replace faulty purge or vent valves

description: Intake Air Temperature Sensor 1 Circuit High
details: This code indicates that the intake air temperature sensor is reporting a value that is too high, which could lead to improper fuel combustion and performance issues.
causes: Wiring issues such as shorts or breaks
solutions: Replace intake air temperature sensor if necessary
Repair or replace damaged wiring or connectors

details: The transmission range sensor is malfunctioning, causing improper gear selection or failure to shift gears, leading to poor transmission performance.
causes: Faulty gear shifter or shift linkage
solutions: Replace the transmission range sensor
Repair or replace damaged wiring
Check and repair gear shifter or shift linkage

details: The engine's second cylinder is misfiring, which could lead to poor engine performance, higher emissions, and potential engine damage if not addressed.
causes: Faulty spark plug or coil pack for cylinder 2
solutions: Replace spark plug and coil pack in cylinder 2
Check and clean fuel injectors
Repair any vacuum leaks near cylinder 2

details: The vehicle speed sensor is malfunctioning, causing incorrect speed readings on the dashboard and potential transmission issues.
solutions: Replace vehicle speed sensor
Repair or replace damaged sensor wiring
Check and replace faulty instrument cluster

description: Mass Air Flow Sensor Circuit Range/Performance Problem
details: The mass airflow (MAF) sensor is reading values outside of the expected range, which can cause the engine to run lean or rich, leading to poor performance and higher emissions.
causes: Air leaks between MAF sensor and throttle body
solutions: Clean or replace MAF sensor
Repair any air leaks
Replace clogged air filter

details: The transmission control system has detected a malfunction, which may lead to erratic shifting or the vehicle being stuck in a single gear.
causes: Damaged wiring in the transmission control system
solutions: Replace transmission control module if necessary
Repair or replace damaged wiring
Check and refill transmission fluid levels
